comments.body: I think using `unlist(mleap::mleap_installed_versions()$mleap) %>% max() %>% as.character()` should also work and is probably more readable but it's also taste I guess.
I thought so too but unfortunately no: `unlist()` strips the `numeric_version` from the class of the operand, so the rest of the pipe won't work correctly

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +27,31 @@    purrr::map(~ numeric_version(.x)) %>%
    purrr::reduce(~ (if (.x > .y) .x else .y)) %>%
    as.character()

  conda_env <- create_default_conda_env_if_absent(

comments.body: Quick check did not give me an answer, so: Is model.zip the file name currently used with MLeap models in mlflow? Also, at some point, it might be good to keep model names for all flavors in a variable in the R mlflow namespace instead of defining them ad-hoc once on saving and once on loading.
For MLeap currently it just needs to be any file name ending with `.zip`. Defining it in 1 variable sounds like a good idea.
